SENT.plain: A-46-year-old woman with a prior history of a spontaneously resolving right central retinal artery occlusion presented with an acute right third order Horner's syndrome and vague ocular pain
Magnetic resonance angiography demonstrated a right internal carotid artery dissection
The dissection improved on anticoagulation therapy
Marfans syndrome or Ehlers-Danlos syndrome was suspected but ruled out by clinical criteria and skin biopsy respectively
